results.title: Udaipur, city of lakes
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and P.R.S. Pillay
results.brief_description: This beautiful lakeside city of India attracts tourists from all over the world. Udaipur is a city of palaces, surrounded by hills and lakes essential for irrigation which also enhance the landscape. Wonderful gardens, temples decorated with carved marble and a tower of victory built in the 15th century are examples of the beauty of this city. These religious people love festivals; with a boat procession on the lake and girls wearing colorful saris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and P.R.S. Pillay

results.title: Ubu
results.creator_credit: Grand Slamm Animation, Arts Council of Great Britain and Geoff Dunbar
results.brief_description: Ubu Roi was written by Alfred Jarry as a schoolboy in 1888. It’s first public performance was in 1896 and it immediately gained the notoriety that it continues to enjoy. The bare bones of the story are those of ‘Macbeth’. For this animated version, Geoff Dunbar has invented a brutal graphic style and ‘language’ of sounds to re-create the explosive impact of Jerry’s original production. Animated by Geoff Dunbar, Annabel Jankel, Ian Lewis, Ginger Gibbons and assisted by Tony Barnes and Gail Wright. Based on the play ‘Ubu Roi’ by Alfred Jarry.

results.title: U.S.A.
results.creator_credit: Ideal Pictures (US) and Henry Strauss Productions
results.brief_description: A visual account of the life, industries, environment and history of the USA. Includes some original photographs showing aspects of the pioneering of the country.

results.title: U.N. Kindergarten
results.brief_description: Deals with the kindergarten set up to cater for the children of United Nations officials in New York. Children of 25 nationalities work and play together amicably as a practical example of international cooperation.

results.title: U.N. in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: With minimum supervision from their teacher, seventh-grade school children conduct a model classroom assembly, patterned after a session of the United Nations, and debate an issue. The film demonstrates an original approach in helping children get to know the world they live in.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane

results.title: Tyrannosaurus Rex
results.creator_credit: WGBH Educational Foundation and D. Keith Carlson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child”
Children are shown working together on a project to reconstruct the land of dinosaurs, using papier-mache to create hills, trees, a moat, and some shallow water. They paint and classify toy models of dinosaurs.

results.title: Typing technique
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Michael Law
results.brief_description: A number of common errors by typists illustrated and corrected in a humorous manner. The items covered include the taking of dictation, proper sitting posture when typing, general typing technique and care of the machine.

results.title: Typing skills: position and keystroke
results.creator_credit: Coronet Films, Creative Establishment and Don B. Klugman
results.brief_description: Janet Wilner’s company selected her for a time-mtion study and discovered that good typing starts with a typist’s position at the typewriter and with the way she manages her keystroke. Extensive slow-motion photography reveals the basic elements of good typing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Coronet Films, Creative Establishment and Don B. Klugman

results.title: Typing skills: daily job techniques. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Illustrates that on-the-job proficiency requires adequate preparation for the day’s work, in addition to mastery of basic operating skills. Shows how a typist can eliminate needless movement and increase her output.
